title: "Getting Started with R"

To download R, go to:
https://www.r-project.org/

Download by clicking on a link closest to your location:
https://cran.r-project.org/mirrors.html

For me it's the Oak Ridge mirror https://mirrors.nics.utk.edu/cran/

Click Download R for Windows
https://mirrors.nics.utk.edu/cran/

Click "Base"
Download R and install using the default settings.

Download RStudio from:
https://posit.co/download/rstudio-desktop/

Tools > Global Options

General > Basic

- uncheck "Restore most recently opened project at startup"
- uncheck "Restore previously open source documents at startup"
- uncheck "Restore .RData into workspace at startup"

Create a "Projects" folder

General > Advanced Tab

Code > Editing
- Check "Use native pipe operator, |>

Appearance
- Choose an Editor theme

Install git
http://git-scm.com/downloads
- Use Notepad as the default editor
- Override the default branch name, keep as "main"

Download Quarto
https://quarto.org/docs/download/

Install as administrator
